recommendations: Prioritize patch management: Only 3 out of 22 Windows workstations are fully patched. Address the 19 devices requiring updates, including resolving 3 installation errors and 2 pending reboots.
Improve software management: The software compliance score is 12%, indicating outdated third‑party applications. Schedule updates for commonly used software to reduce security vulnerabilities.
Resolve disk‑space issues: 2 devices have less than 15% free space on the system drive. Clean up unnecessary files or expand storage to prevent performance and stability problems.
Reduce monitoring alerts: The monitoring score is 63% due to 129 high‑priority alerts unresolved. Investigate and resolve these alerts to improve network health and service delivery.
Enhance overall device compliance: Only 1 out of 25 devices passed all health checks. Review the failing checks (especially disk space and patch status) and implement corrective actions.
Ensure antivirus coverage on remaining devices: 2 devices lack up‑to‑date antivirus protection. Verify installation and update status to maintain a 100% coverage target.

summary.executive_summary: This is a comprehensive monthly support report for ASPIRA for January 2026. The average service score for the month was 55%. A total of 2 tickets were processed, with 23 devices having antivirus installed, and 3 devices fully patched.
